an4.184:1.1: Then the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
an4.184:1.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha:
an4.184:2.1: “Master Gotama, this is my doctrine and view:
an4.184:2.2: ‘All those liable to death are frightened and terrified of death.’”
an4.184:2.3: “Brahmin, some of those liable to death are frightened and terrified of death.
an4.184:2.4: But some of those liable to death are not frightened and terrified of death.
an4.184:3.1: Who are those frightened of death?
an4.184:3.2: It’s someone who isn’t free of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures.
an4.184:3.5: ‘The sensual pleasures that I love so much will leave me, and I’ll leave them.’
an4.184:3.6: They sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:3.7: This is someone who is frightened of death.
an4.184:4.1: Furthermore, it’s someone who isn’t free of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for the body.
an4.184:4.4: ‘This body that I love so much will leave me, and I’ll leave it.’
an4.184:4.5: They sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:4.6: This, too, is someone who is frightened of death.
an4.184:5.1: Furthermore, it’s someone who hasn’t done good and skillful things that keep them safe, but has done bad, violent, and depraved things.
an4.184:5.4: ‘Well, I haven’t done good and skillful things that keep me safe.
an4.184:5.5: And I have done bad, violent, and depraved things.
an4.184:5.6: When I depart, I’ll go to the place where people who’ve done such things go.’
an4.184:5.7: They sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:5.8: This, too, is someone who is frightened of death.
an4.184:6.1: Furthermore, it’s someone who’s doubtful, uncertain, and undecided about the true teaching.
an4.184:6.4: ‘I’m doubtful, uncertain, and undecided about the true teaching.’
an4.184:6.5: They sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:6.6: This, too, is someone who is frightened of death.
an4.184:6.7: These are the four people liable to death who are frightened and terrified of death.
an4.184:7.1: Who are those not frightened of death?
an4.184:7.2: It’s someone who is rid of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures.
an4.184:7.5: ‘The sensual pleasures that I love so much will leave me, and I’ll leave them.’
an4.184:7.6: They don’t sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:7.7: This is someone who’s not frightened of death.
an4.184:8.1: Furthermore, it’s someone who is rid of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for the body.
an4.184:8.4: ‘This body that I love so much will leave me, and I’ll leave it.’
an4.184:8.5: They don’t sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:8.6: This, too, is someone who’s not frightened of death.
an4.184:9.1: Furthermore, it’s someone who hasn’t done bad, violent, and corrupt deeds, but has done good and skillful deeds that keep them safe.
an4.184:9.4: ‘Well, I haven’t done bad, violent, and depraved things.
an4.184:9.5: And I have done good and skillful deeds that keep me safe.
an4.184:9.6: When I depart, I’ll go to the place where people who’ve done such things go.’
an4.184:9.7: They don’t sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:9.8: This, too, is someone who’s not frightened of death.
an4.184:10.1: Furthermore, it’s someone who’s not doubtful, uncertain, or undecided about the true teaching.
an4.184:10.4: ‘I’m not doubtful, uncertain, or undecided about the true teaching.’
an4.184:10.5: They don’t sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:10.6: This, too, is someone who’s not frightened of death.
an4.184:10.7: These are the four people liable to death who are not frightened and terrified of death.”
an4.184:11.1: “Excellent, Master Gotama! … From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
